channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Axed England stars Phil Foden and Mason Greenwood tried to sneak FOUR women into quarantine hotel
item.description: Icelandic beauty queen Nadia Sif Lindal Gunnarsdottir, 20, and her cousin Lara Clausen, a 19-year-old law student, went to visit the shamed players in their hotel room.

item.title: Protesters who yelled at diners says the confrontation sparked after men shouted 'Blue Lives Matter'
item.description: The protesters who confronted outdoor diners in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, said the confrontation began after a group of men yelled 'Blue Lives Matter' and one man swung a bike.

item.title: Harris speaks to Jacob Blake and meets family in Wisconsin
item.description: Democratic vice presidential nominee Kamala Harris spoke with Kenosha shooting victim Jacab Blake by phone Monday, while she was meeting with familly members in Milwaukee.

item.title: Cardi B hits back at Candace Owens for calling her an 'embarrassment' for Biden interview
item.description: The feud began on Sunday when Owens, 31, shared a clip of her on The Ben Shapiro Show, in which she said slammed Democratic nominee Joe Biden for taking part in an interview with Cardi B.

item.title: Suspected migrant is caught in British tourist's ROOF BOX when drivers hear thumping sounds
item.description: The shocked driver was parked at Maidstone Services this morning when a group of concerned motorists gathered after hearing a 'thumping sound' coming from the car's roof box.

item.title: 'When will you resign, then?' UN Secretary General sparks anger with 'patriarchy' tweet
item.description: The UN's official Twitter account published part of a speech by Secretary General António Guterres, who was speaking on how the outbreak of Covid-19 has affected women.

item.title: Woman fears short tanning sessions caused cancerous lump on nose
item.description: Despite it being illegal to use sunbeds at tanning salons below age 18, Gemma, from Blackpool, found a way around it. 'My friend's parents hired a sunbed at their home and I used it,' she recalls.

item.title: 23-year-old 'was heading to the WRONG Ibis hotel after a night out'
item.description: Jacob Billington, 23, was with a group of old school friends from Liverpool when he was stabbed in the early hours on Sunday. A resident said the group had been heading to the wrong hotel.

item.title: Scout, 15, is shot in the jaw on his way to school in Suffolk 'by friend after they fell out'
item.description: The unnamed Year 11 pupil had been returning to Kesgrave High School near Ipswich in Suffolk for the first time since lockdown when he was blasted in the jaw, according to witnesses.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Farm shop spat puts Jeremy Clarkson into a spin
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: He is worth £50 million and has a multitude of adoring fans all over the globe. But the irrepressible Jeremy Clarkson doesn't get everything his own way.

item.title: No wonder they want to stay at home! Commuters are saving £250 a month by staying away
item.description: Despite ministers urging Britons to return to the office, recent figures show National Rail passenger journeys at the start of September hovering around 30 per cent of what would be typical.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Grant Shapps adds Greek islands to quarantine list
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps revealed that Lesvos, Tinos, Serifos, Mykonos, Crete, Santorini and Zakynthos are being added to the 'red' list as of 4am on Wednesday.

item.title: Deputy Chief Medical officer warns Britain faces 'a bumpy ride over the next few months'
item.description: Professor Jonathan Van-Tam said on Monday that the public had 'relaxed too much' over the summer and described the rising number of cases as of 'great concern'.

item.title: Thirteen Queen's guardsmen jailed for attending cocaine-fuelled rave during coronavirus lockdown
item.description: They partied with members of the public which meant they had broken a 'bubble' put in place as the Queen and Prince Philip were shielding inside.

item.title: Up to £3.5bn of furlough cash may have been paid out in wrong or fraudulent claims
item.description: Up to £3.5 billion of furlough cash may have been paid out in wrong or fraudulent claims, according to official Government estimates.

item.title: No 10 warns Brussels to 'get real' and accept Britain is an 'independent country'
item.description: Lord Frost, the UK's chief negotiator with the EU, said the two sides 'can no longer afford to go over well-trodden ground' in the deadlocked discussions.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: All pretence is gone, Harry and Meghan have no Royal future
item.description: RICHARD KAY: A source close to the couple confirmed they were no longer receiving financial support from Harry's father, the Prince of Wales.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle pay back £2.4m Frogmore Cottage cash
item.description: The payment was made possible thanks to the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's new multi-million pound Netflix deal, a source said.

item.title: 'Duped' ex-PR for Extinction Rebellion quit... to fight for the nuclear industry, writes GUY ADAMS
item.description: GUY ADAMS: One of the great 'car-crash' TV interviews of our age occurred in Andrew Neil's BBC studio around lunchtime on October 9, last year.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: The news you missed in lockdown (Part I) - how sausage rolls can save the nation!
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: A previously unknown member of the Kardashian family, Alexa's new job, and the Princess Royal launching a new Foundation in a village hall over a cold sausage roll.

item.title: Digital reconstruction of 15th-Century monk's face show he looked like an elderly Wayne Rooney
item.description: Experts used a well-preserved skull and biographical information to put together a digital reconstruction of a 15th-century face using CT scans.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... the XR printworks protest
item.description: 'Despite your lot's very best efforts, I saw your arrest in my newspaper, son'

item.title: Theatre-goers and sport spectators could get 24-hour 'Covid passes'
item.description: Fans of live entertainment could return to venues without social distancing within weeks as officials are ordered to move at 'extreme pace' to encourage crowds to attend events.

item.title: Cut quarantine with coronavirus test BEFORE your flight home
item.description: Plans would see holidaymakers firstly tested 48 hours before arriving the UK, before then undergoing a second test five days after landing. If both are negative, they could leave quarantine.

item.title: Woman 'killed pregnant friend and cut unborn child from her womb'
item.description: Rozalba Grimm and her husband Zulmiar Schiestl have been charged with the death of Flávia Godinho in Brazil. Grimm allegedly admitted to ripping the unborn baby from Godinho's womb.

item.title: SIR JOHN BELL: We cannot live in terror cut off from the world. We MUST get Britain open again
item.description: SIR JOHN BELL: We must remove or reduce fear of the virus so we can focus on the other essential parts of our recovery from the pandemic. We must get the economy back on track and fast.

item.title: David and Victoria Beckham 'caught coronavirus while partying in LA'
item.description: It has been claimed that it was Miami that the football legend, 45, began to feel unwell, with his designer wife, 46, developing a sore throat and a high temperature soon after

item.title: Spain becomes first country in western Europe to top 500,000 Covid cases
item.description: Spain is experiencing a second surge of infections after schools reopening. A total of 525,549 cases were recorded on Monday. Cases are more common in younger people who often have no symptoms.

item.title: Spain becomes first country in western Europe to top 500,000 Covid cases
item.description: Spain is experiencing a second surge of infections after schools reopening. A total of 525,549 cases were recorded on Monday. Cases are more common in younger people who often have no symptoms.

item.title: How filtering blood may help to combat Covid-19
item.description: A filter packed with beads that work like a sponge could be used to treat Covid-19. The device removes potentially toxic compounds called cytokines by purifying patients' blood.

item.title: Can popping a pill ever beat obesity? We ask the experts for the pros and cons
item.description: Tackling obesity is 'one of the greatest long-term health challenges' this country faces, the Government announced recently as it launched a new strategy to address it.

item.title: 60,000 Britons may have suffered 'Long Covid' for over THREE MONTHS
item.description: Professor Tim Spector, who is leading the Covid Symptom Study app, said that 60,000 people have been ill for more than three months, ranging from mild forms to being wheelchair-bound or bedridden.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: HMS Queen Elizabeth postpones sailing due to cases
item.description: The aircraft carrier, which is currently in Portsmouth, has postponed its sail for 24 hours after up to 10 crew members tested positive for coronavirus.

item.title: Thousands pack on to beaches in Rio de Janeiro despite Brazil suffering 800 COVID deaths a day
item.description: Thousands crowded onto Rio de Janeiro's Ipanema beach this weekend. The shoreline was filled with hundreds of umbrellas and families sunning themselves.

item.title: Leading Swedish MEP CHARLIE WEIMERS reveals why he is fed up with Monsieur Barnier
item.description: CHARLIE WEIMERS: When Michel Barnier, the EU's chief negotiator, sits down to resume Brexit negotiations with his British counterpart David Frost today, let's hope he has learned his lesson.

item.title: Ever wondered who inspired James Bond's bizarre gadgets? New book reveals genius who was REAL 'Q'
item.description: Christopher Clayton Hutton or 'Clutty' (pictured left) was the genius inventor behind gadgets that helped British and Allied troops escape during the war.

item.title: Government uses new regional travel corridors to slap restrictions on SEVEN Greek islands
item.description: Transport Secretary Grant Shapps said the long-awaited move to treat islands as separate to their mainland would bring much-needed relief to Britain's travel sector.

item.title: Conrad Black wife BARBARA AMIEL reveals she confirmed that money can't buy true friends
item.description: BARBARA AMIEL, wife of media tycoon Conrad Black, recalled how she and her husband - once the toast of London and New York society - became social outcasts.

item.title: Robert Jenrick announces £12billion boost to build 180,000 affordable homes
item.description: Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick announced a £12 billion boost for housing. Scheme would provide up to 180,000 new 'affordable' homes to make it easier for families to get on the housing ladder.

item.title: A 20- year old memorial tree, dedicated to murdered TV presenter Jill Dando, was cut down by mistake
item.description: The 20-year-old memorial tree in for late TV presenter Jill Dando was accidentally cut down at Walnut Gardens in Exeter, Devon by bungling developers building student homes.

item.title: Animal rights activists linked to Extinction Rebellion blockade Manchester slaughterhouse
item.description: Activists locked themselves onto coffins outside the entrance of Tulip pig slaughterhouse in Manchester this afternoon.

item.title: Dominic Raab summons Russian ambassador over Navalny attack
item.description: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab voiced relief at news that the Vladimir Putin opponent was showing an improvement in his condition.

item.title: Scotland and Wales put half a million more people under local lockdowns after spike in cases
item.description: Renfrewshire and East Dunbartonshire in Scotland will see restrictions reimposed from midnight tonight, with a similar clampdown for Caerphilly, Wales coming into force from 6pm tomorrow.

item.title: Fiona Bruce, 56, admits she 'didn't expect to be working' at her age
item.description: Fiona Bruce has admitted that she 'didn't expect to be working' at her age as she discusses her presenting roles in a candid new interview.

item.title: Could magnesium pills be the secret to staying strong in later life?
item.description: A recently published study from the University of East Anglia, involving 441 people, found a direct link between physical strength in older people and the amount of magnesium in their muscle tissue.

item.title: The Crown's Emma Corrin says she got to know Princess Diana 'like you would a friend'
item.description: The long-awaited fourth series of The Crown will document Princess Diana's meeting and eventual marriage to Prince Charles, along with the births and early years of the two Princes

item.title: Cases of Covid-19 were at least THREE TIMES higher than official statistics showed, study
item.description: Analysis of GP appointments in London show 8,985 suspected Covid-19 cases by April 30 - treble the amount who tested positive at swabbing centres. Pictured: Daily cases.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: If Extinction Rebellion and BLM want power, let them stand for election
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Britain has strict laws against discrimination on the grounds of race, creed, colour and sexual orientation. You can never appease the wilder fringes of XR and BLM.

item.title: Prostate cancer referrals 'dropped by HALF during lockdown'
item.description: Urgent GP referrals for prostate cancer have dropped to the lowest level for ten years, NHS data reveals. Experts say the fall means around 3,500 cases of advanced cancer haven't been diagnosed.

item.title: Colin Firth and Hugh Grant turn 60 this week, so which of them would seduce Bridget Jones today?
item.description: Hugh Grant and Colin Firth both celebrate their 60th birthdays this week. CLAUDIA CONNELL imagines how Bridget Jones might look back on their lives so far.

item.title: 'Don't kill your gran' by spreading coronavirus, Matt Hancock urges young people
item.description: Scientists said it's beginning to look like the UK is 'moving into a period of exponential growth'. But the Health Secretary said cases were not out of control but the rise in cases was 'concerning'.

item.title: Getting to the root of women's hair loss: DR MARTIN SCURR answers your health questions
item.description: DR MARTIN SCURR: Hair loss is linked to a wide range of medical problems, generally affecting the hair growth cycle or the hair follicle itself.

item.title: Julian Assange's fiancee is seen outside court with friend-of-the-stars lawyer
item.description: Stella Moris, 37, who is herself a lawyer, was seen walking under the wing of Ms Robinson as the pair arrived at the Old Bailey this morning to support Assange.

item.title: Coronavirus: Pupils sent home from school across UK amid outbreaks
item.description: School visited by Boris Johnson - Castle Rock High School in Leicestershire - put a number of pupils into self-isolation after a staff member tested positive.

item.title: San Andreas Fault tremors are triggered by SUPERHEATED rocks deep below the surface
item.description: New models reveal how earthquakes on the San Andreas Fault happen. Plates gliding below the surface heat rocks at 650F, changing them to a fluid-like state that causes instability in the bedrock.

item.title: Listen up! Why you MUST have your ears tested in your 50s
item.description: Hearing loss isn't just something that strikes in old age: you may be surprised to learn that more than 40 per cent of the over-50s are affected.

item.title: 'Self-cleaning' products claim to help fight off viruses, reviewed
item.description: A slew of antibacterial, antiviral and other 'self-cleaning' products have come on to the market. Are they the answer to cleaner living, or just capitalising on consumer concerns about hygiene?

item.title: Colombia judge refuses to marry two women claiming he chose to follow 'the law of God'
item.description: Judge Ramiro Flórez refused to marry two women in Colombia because he chose to follow 'God's law', despite same-sex marriage being legal in the country

item.title: Coronavirus US: New York positivity rate below 1% after 31 days
item.description: On Monday New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo announced the state has remained below a one percent COVID-19 positivity rate for 31 days straight.

item.title: Mother who 'married Isis fighter' was among those arrested at Extinction Rebellion protests
item.description: Two years ago, Natalie Bracht made headlines over claims she had fled the UK in 2014 and travelled to Syria where she married an Islamic State fighter.

item.title: Britain's Got Talent receives 1,121 Ofcom complaints
item.description: The performance, which narrated the senseless killing of George Floyd in May, had already polarised fans of the mainstream talent show before a faction aired their grievances.

item.title: China's COVID-19 vaccine triggers an immune response - but it's weaker in over-60s
item.description: One of China's lead candidate coronavirus vaccines safely triggered an immune response that may help fight off the infection in 90% of trial participants. Responses were weaker in over-60s.

item.title: Revolting pictures show giant fatbergs caused by flushed wet wipes removed from sewers in Suffolk
item.description: The images have been shared online showing the consequences of flushing items, including nappies and sanitary products, down the toilet which combine with fats, oils and greases in the sewers.

item.title: 400-year-old goat remains find helps DNA conservation techniques
item.description: Preserved remains of a 400-year-old goat have been found in a remote section of the Italian Alps. The ancient specimen will help improve the conservation of future 'ice mummies.'

item.title: DNA testing 'can predict throat cancer up to eight YEARS' in advance
item.description: Statistical model built by scientists at the University of Cambridge and European Bioinformatics Institute reveals the risk of someone with Barratt's oesophagus developing throat cancer.

item.title: Dacia reveals new look, budget-friendly Sandero supermini
item.description: The Sandero has been Britain's cheapest new car since it launched in 2013. Priced from £6,995, it's the most affordable new motor on the market today. But changes for 2021 could see the cost rise.

item.title: Florida deputy put on leave after grabbing boy, 17, by the neck
item.description: Terrance Devon Reed III was taken to hospital after deputy Neil Pizzo was filmed hitting him at the Sarasota County Juvenile Assessment Center last Tuesday.

item.title: Boeing Dreamliners face inspections as defect grounds eight 787 jets
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is considering inspections that could cover hundreds of Boeing Co's 787 Dreamliners after production issues at one plant, according to reports.

item.title: China's Long March 4B rocket booster explodes and crashes into town
item.description: China's Long March 4B rocket made a crash landing following a launch of a satellite into orbit. Footage of the incident shows the rocket falling from space and crashing into a nearby town.

item.title: Police launch manhunt for violent on-the-run prisoner after he fled open jail
item.description: Terry McDonagh is reported to have absconded from Springhill Jail in Buckinghamshire around 5.35pm on Sunday, Thames Valley Police said.

item.title: Award-winning Downton Abbey producer 'sexually assaulting woman'
item.description: Chris Croucher, 39, was set to appear in court after being accused of sexually assaulting a woman in Westminster on December 18. The case was adjourned until September 28.

item.title: Injection could stop the loss of muscle and bone during spaceflight
item.description: Researchers targeted the myostatin/activin A signaling pathway, a cellular mechanism that regulates bone density and skeletal muscle mass.

item.title: Commuters slam transport bosses over cancelled trains and lack of social distancing on London buses
item.description: Commuters have slammed transport bosses over cancelled trains and lack of social distancing on London buses as employees head to work in Monday morning's rush hour.

item.title: Julian Assange's father arrives for WilkiLeaks founder's extradition hearing at the Old Bailey
item.description: Julian Assange has appeared in court this morning as more than 100 protesters gathered outside. Assange's father and partner were seen greeting each other with a kiss outside the Old Bailey.

item.title: Government tells restaurants to slash calories on takeaway and 'on-the-go' foods
item.description: Experts singled out takeaway pizzas as a major source of calories - one pizza can include more than a person's entire daily recommended calorie limit (file photo)

item.title: Calls for XR hypocrites who blockaded printworks to be slapped with £10,000 fines
item.description: Natalie Bracht, 45, is alleged to have become involved with the environmental extremist group after she was arrested outside Newsprinters in Broxbourne on Friday.

item.title: How Saudi Arabia's crown prince won over Donald Trump
item.description: Mohammed bin Salman, the heir to the Saudi throne, welcomed Trump's election victory in 2016 because the new president hated Obama's deal with Iran and seemed to care little about human rights.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn's brother Piers faces another coronavirus fine
item.description: Piers Corbyn, 73, attended an anti-lockdown protest in Sheffield on Saturday, less than a week after he was slapped with a £10,000 fine for organising a similar rally in Trafalgar Square.

item.title: US Open line judge struck by the ball hit by Novak Djokovic bombarded with death threats by trolls
item.description: The US Open line judge hit in the throat with a ball by Novak Djokovic has been subjected to vile online abuse after fans of the world No 1 discovered her Instagram account.

item.title: Why is Boris Johnson threatening to 'tear up' Brexit divorce terms?
item.description: Brexit trade talks were on the verge of collapse today after Boris Johnson threatened to rewrite the terms of the UK's split from the European Union.

item.title: Count of Osorno and Belén Corsini de Lacalle get engaged
item.description: The Count of Osorno, Carlos Fitz-James Stuart y Solís, 28, who is the youngest son of the 19th Duke of Alba, is engaged to his girlfriend Belén Corsini de Lacalle, 31, according to ABC.

item.title: Disabled man who was born with a neuromuscular disease marries his able-bodied fiancée
item.description: Shane Burcaw, 27, and Hannah Aylward, 24, got married in a private ceremony on Zoom this weekend. Shane was born with Spinal Muscular Atrophy (SMA).

item.title: Grandma can't stop laughing as her grandson keeps trying to eat each ingredient of their cookie mix
item.description: Cade, a 24-month-old chef from Indiana, has gone viral after his mother shared a video of him cooking with his grandmother and trying to eat every single one of their ingredients.

item.title: Mexican military seize cartel's homemade TANK converted by covering pickup truck with steel plates
item.description: Mexico's National Guard seized a pickup that had been converted into a tank. The vehicle was found in Apatzingán, Michoacán, and reportedly belonged to the Los Viagras cartel.

item.title: Relatives of 22 people murdered in Manchester Arena bombing fall silent
item.description: Experts said there were 'missed opportunities' to identify Salman Abedi as a threat and take action to stop him as witnesses claim they told officials in Manchester that someone was acting suspiciously.

item.title: You should RUB an itch instead of scratching it to ease the irritation
item.description: Scientists from the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine investigated the neural pathways behind forms of 'itch relief' including rubbing and scratching.

item.title: Percentage of positive Covid-19 tests in the UK has dropped from 40% to less than 2.5%
item.description: Testing data in the UK shows that comparing positive tests now to positive tests at the height of the outbreak is unfair because they only picked up a tiny proportion of the reality at the time.

item.title: Children who catch the common could be immune to MIS-C
item.description: Experts at the Karolinska Institutet in Sweden compared healthy children with youngsters suffering from MIS-C and Kawsaki disease.

item.title: Britain confirms another 2,948 cases of coronavirus
item.description: A further 2,948 Covid-19 cases have been found in the past 24 hours, suggesting yesterday's 'concerning' record high of 2,988 cases were not a one-off.

item.title: Meet Optimism! NASA tests drives Perseverance's twin on Earth
item.description: NASA takes its new Optimism rover for a test drive. This vehicle is the Mars 2020 Perseverance twin and will help scientists anticipate and correct issues the vehicle on Mars may face.

item.title: Virgin Galactic's SpaceShipTwo could launch again next month
item.description: The test flight will see two pilots launch for the edge of space from Spaceport America in New Mexico as early as October 22, the filing revealed.
item.media:description: British billionaire Branson's groundbreaking flight would open the door for commercial trips to begin

item.title: Persil ditches plastic dosing ball as it moves to 100 per cent recyclable bottles
item.description: The plastic ball had come under fire on social media for adding to landfill. Every new bottle came with one attached, despite it being argued that nobody needed more than one.

item.title: Find out if your local Pizza Express restaurant is closing
item.description: The closures span Aberdeen to Torquay, including its original site in Wardour Street in Soho, London, which opened in 1965.
item.media:description: Pizza Express has had plans to shut 73 restaurants approved by creditors (Dominic Lipinski/PA)

item.title: Katie Grand leaves Love magazine more than a decade after founding the publication
item.description: Katie Grand, 49, from Birmingham, who launched the groundbreaking biannual fashion magazine Love in 2009, has revealed she is stepping back from the publication on Instagram.

item.title: Ancient fossils reveal the cartilage-based skeletons of sharks may have evolved from bony fish
item.description: Experts from Imperial College London have been studying the remains of the foot long creature that is an ancient cousin of the whale shark and great white.

item.title: Biology: Staring at seagulls makes them MORE likely to flee, study finds
item.description: Researchers from Exeter found that they could get around 6.5 feet (2 metres) closer to the scavenging seabirds if they didn't look directly at them while approaching.

item.title: Indelible Joel Meyerowitz color images capture America in the 1960s and '70s
item.description: In his new book, Joel Meyerowitz: How I Make Photographs, the famed street photographer offers lesson for novices and indelible images from his decades-long career.

item.title: Britain's oldest twins leave This Morning viewers in hysterics
item.description: Doris Hobday and Lil Cox, 96, from Birmingham, appeared on This Morning today to discuss how they have become local celebrities. The duo left viewers in hysterics.

item.title: Britain's post-lockdown property boom: UK house prices hit record high
item.description: The average price of a property has tipped over £245,000 for the first time on record, according to an index released today by Halifax.

item.title: Tourists are left 'hanging upside down on a malfunctioning rollercoaster' at a Chinese park
item.description: Social media footage shows the rollercoaster carriage packed with riders being stuck on the rail on Saturday at Rongchuang Amusement Park in Wuxi, Jiangsu province. No one was injured.

item.title: American Airlines faces backlash after allowing cabin crew to wear Black Lives Matter pins on duty
item.description: America's largest commercial jet carrier announced on Sunday that it would be introducing the policy across its fleet. But it has run into opposition among staff who are 'completely disgusted'.

item.title: Art Attack's Neil Buchanan denies speculation that he's Banksy
item.description: British TV personality Neil Buchanan, 58, has responded to rumours circulating on social media. A Twitter user racked up over 2,000 re-tweets on a post suggesting Neil is Banksy.

item.title: Jamal Khashoggi murder: Saudi Arabia convicts eight of killing
item.description: Saudi Arabia has convicted eight people of killing Jamal Khashoggi and has jailed them for up to 20 years.

item.title: Charlie Hebdo massacre survivors walk out in tears as images of the attack are shown to Paris court
item.description: The court in Paris sat through the graphic images showing the scenes during and after the 2015 newsroom attack.
item.media:credit: COURTESY OF JORDI MIR/AFP via Ge

item.title: Screaming baby hoisted from latest boat packed with migrants caught trying to cross English Channel
item.description: A screaming baby was among the 14 migrants rescued from another boat attempting to cross the channel today after a weekend which saw 21 make the crossing.

item.title: Fifth of CO2 emissions come from supply chain for large companies
item.description: Carbon emissions from multinationals' foreign investment were 18.7 per cent of of all emissions in 2016, scientists from the UK and China found.

item.title: Climate change: Eating plants, not meat, could remove 16 years' worth of CO2 emissions by 2050
item.description: Researchers from the US calculated that broad uptake of such plant-based protein alternatives could free up land to support more ecosystems that absorb carbon.

item.title: Probiotics 'could reduce obesity in children' and reduce their risk of serious diseases
item.description: The study, by researchers in Italy, followed 100 obese children who were either put on a calorie-restricted diet or one that included probiotics. It found that those receiving probiotics lost more weight.

item.title: Wildlife volunteers rescue leopard cub from 30ft well in India
item.description: The team of wildlife volunteers gently lowered a cage into the 30ft well in an effort to rescue the three-month-old female cub in the village of Pargaon, Maharashtra, India.

item.title: Top tips for cleaning windows like a professional
item.description: It is far too easy to end up with smudged and smeared panes, but we reveal the correct way to clean your windows.

item.title: Belarus opposition figure Maria Kolesnikova is bundled into a minibus by masked men
item.description: Kolesnikova, 38, is the only member of the female triumvirate fighting against President Alexander Lukashenko's dubious August 9 re-election to have remained in the country.

item.title: Malcolm Turnbull reignites feud with Tony Abbott by calling new UK trade advisor role a 'beat up'
item.description: Mr Abbott was last month appointed to the role of trade envoy - a move sparking controversy in Britain with Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon calling him a 'misogynist' and 'sexist'.

item.title: Asian grooming gangs victim tells how she was trafficked and abused by dozens of men
item.description: Lauren Elysia Priddey was 18 when she was raped and terrorised by cousins Mohammed Ali Sultan and Shahmeel Khan in separate attacks, only days apart.

item.title: Producer who conned Dragons' Den entrepreneur James Caan's firm out of £519,000 must pay back £85
item.description: David Shipley has been convicted of lying to secure a £519,000 loan from TV star James Caan's business, Resourcing Capital Ventures, in 2014, but will only have to pay £85.72.

item.title: Emma Barnett revealed as new host of Woman's Hour after Jane Garvey announced she was leaving
item.description: Emma Barnett, 35, from Manchester, will take on the role of main host of the programme from January 2021 when Jane Garvey, 56, will leave to host her own interview series on BBC Radio 4.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle insist Invictus Games fundraiser was axed because of Covid
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have revealed a glittering Invictus Games fundraiser set for June 2021 has been cancelled as it is 'no longer viable,' due to Covid-19.

item.title: Novichok poisoning: Alexei Navalny comes OUT of induced coma
item.description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has been taken out of an induced coma and is responsive.

item.title: Rampaging GOAT raids police car before chewing up paperwork and knocking an officer to the ground
item.description: The body-cam footage was recorded by a police deputy in north-central Georgia last week. The officer was serving civil papers at a house in the area when she spotted the goat inside her car.

item.title: China 'KIDNAPS' five Indian citizens in disputed border territory
item.description: The five missing men are from the Indian state of Arunachal Pradesh, which China claims as South Tibet, and the Indian Army said it had made representations to the People's Liberation Army.

item.title: Archaeology: Hillfort dating back up to 3,000 years discovered near the top of Arthur's Seat
item.description: The prehistoric walls atop the extinct volcano overlooking Edinburgh were built by the Votadini - an Iron-Age Celtic tribe who once lived in south-east Scotland and north-east England.

item.title: Teenage girl, 19, suffers severe brain infection after popping a pimple on the tip of her nose
item.description: The 19-year-old from China, known by her surname Yang, felt a persistent pain under the skin around her right eye soon after she squeezed the red spot on the tip of her nose.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Winter wave 'could overwhelm 87% NHS hospitals'
item.description: The startling figures were revealed by a comparison of the average number of beds needed in England between December 2019 and February 2020 and the number required for Covid-19 patients in April.

item.title: Vaccine for coronavirus most likely to come in 'first few months' of 2021, Matt Hancock reveals
item.description: The jab was expected at the end of 2020 but its creators have had to temper expectations after community transmission began to fizzle out in Britain and stall crucial efficacy trials.

item.title: The common mistakes home cooks make - and how to avoid them
item.description: Australian cook and food author Helen Tzouganatos has revealed the six common mistakes home cooks make, and how to avoid making them in your kitchen.

item.title: Guardians of the Galaxy star Michael Rooker details his 'epic' fight against COVID-19
item.description: Michael Rooker faced an 'epic battle' with coronavirus, but he has now tested negative.

item.title: UK staycations: The little-known gems that are perfect for a brilliant break, from Somerset to Wales
item.description: Our writers dived off the UK's tourist trail to visit places that might, at first, not sound much to boast about, but turned out to be nothing short of a revelation...

item.title: Domino's launches VEGAN pizzas and dips nationwide after trial
item.description: Domino's has delighted fans by finally launching a vegan pizza in all its stores in the UK and Republic of Ireland, as well as plant-based dough balls and dairy-free Garlic & Herb dip.

item.title: Savvy shopper bags massive Tesco grocery haul including a whole chicken for just £11.92
item.description: Kelly Costa, from Essex, posted pictures of her yellow sticker shop to the Facebook group Feeding a family on £1 a day, where she revealed she got the bargain haul at Tesco Extra in Lakeside.

item.title: Michelle Obama reveals there were 'times she wanted to push Barack out of the window'
item.description: The former US first lady, 56, told young couples that 'if that breaks a marriage, then Barack and I have been broken off and on... but we have a very strong marriage.'

item.title: Netflix boss Reed Hastings who scored a deal with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle shares his secrets
item.description: Reed Hastings, whose California-based company signed a deal with the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, offers up advice to would-be moguls in No Rules Rules: Netflix and the Culture of Reinvention.

item.title: 430 'gas bombs' discovered in the Arctic at risk of exploding and creating huge craters
item.description: So far, 17 large holes have formed since 2014 in the Yamal and Gydan peninsulas in Siberia due to vast methane eruptions in thawing permafrost.

item.title: Baby is the 'spitting image' of Boo from Monsters Inc
item.description: Tayah Murphy, who was born 15 days late at William Harvey Hospital in Ashford, Kent, came into the world with a glossy black mane that shocked her mother Corrina Anderson, 33.

item.title: Baby sleeping bags sold online could kill children, report warns
item.description: Baby sleeping bags sold on online marketplaces and well-known High Street stores have been found to fail safety tests and could prove fatal to a child, a new consumer watchdog report warns.

item.title: More than HALF of medium-sized businesses planning to axe jobs
item.description: A new survey showed many firms are expecting to make at least some of their workforce redundant as the Chancellor removes state subsidies for wages.

item.title: China quietly lands its ultra-secret experimental spacecraft
item.description: China has landed its secretive reusable experimental spacecraft back on Earth after a successful two-day test flight in the northwestern Chinese region of Inner Mongolia.

item.title: Kate Garraway reveals husband Derek Draper lost EIGHT STONE during his six-month coronavirus battle
item.description: Derek, 53, was hospitalised on March 29 after suffering serious complications from Covid-19 and has remained in intensive care ever since, in a minimally conscious state.

item.title: Boris Johnson 'is resisting pressure' to publish Priti Patel bullying report
item.description: The report was commissioned back in March and Downing Street has faced repeated questions for months over when the findings will be released.

item.title: Doc Martin set to END in 2021 after 17 years on screen
item.description: ITV has confirmed that the 10th series of the comedy-drama will be its last, with filming set to begin in the spring to air later that year. The comedy-drama first appeared on screens in 2004.

item.title: Epidemics lead to a rise in racism, conspiracy theories and civil unrest
item.description: Researchers from Italy analysed 57 past epidemics - finding that the turmoil from each outbreak tended to result in a quieting of existing unrest.

item.title: Young girl out buying art supplies is wrestled to the ground by Hong Kong riot police
item.description: The child was seen in the video circulated online trying to run away from a group of officers who then tackled the young girl to the ground. Police arrested 289 people at protests on Sunday.

item.title: Australia's PM warns Facebook and Google 'I don't respond well to threats'
item.description: Canberra's legislation, drafted by the competition regulator, demands that the multi-billion dollar Silicon Valley giants negotiate fees with news companies whose stories appear on their websites.

item.title: Flying V aeroplane model gets its first test flight
item.description: Engineers performed a successful maiden flight of the scale model, which measures 10 feet in width and weighs 50 pounds, at the secret German air base.

item.title: Independent columnist who masterminded Extinction Rebellion blockade compares press to Nazis
item.description: Donnachadh McCarthy, 61, has emerged as one of the leading figures in the Extinction Rebellion blockade of printworks in Hertfordshire and Knowsley, and justified the attack on press freedom.

item.title: Experts reveal the best places to keep foods fresh
item.description: British luxury wine and food hamper retailer Virginia Hayward, has revealed how 30 different foods and drinks should be stored for safe consumption and maintaining freshness.

item.title: Government's £32 MILLION bet on futuristic healthcare technology
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: They will be formally announced by Science Minister, Amanda Solloway, MP for Derby North, later today at the launch of London Tech Week.

item.title: Bride-to-be reveals her parents gave her $10,000 wedding fund to her step-sister
item.description: A US bride shared her frustration after her parents gave her $10,000 wedding fund to her step-sister to plan her nuptials even though she'd received her share prior to Covid-19.

item.title: Pensioner blows his house up while trying to kill a fly with electrified bug swatter
item.description: A French pensioner blew up his kitchen and the roof above it while trying to kill a fly at his home in the Dordogne village of Parcoul-Chenaud, north east of Bordeaux, on Friday.
